answers.text: children did not exceed the education of their parents

qas.question: Who do students often blame for their education short comings?

plausible_answers.text: children did not exceed the education of their parents

qas.question: What are some of the claims being pointed towards education equality?
Who do students never blame for their education short comings?
What happens when someone doesn't try to improve education?
What is not a goal of education?
What are the intended products of our current educational process?

context: Some claim that there is education inequality because <a0_0><b3_0>children did not exceed the education of their parents<b3_0/><a0_0/>. This education inequality is then associated with income inequality. Although <b6_0>critical thinking<b6_0/> is a goal of education, <b7_0>criticism and blame<b7_0/> are often the unintended by products of our current educational process. Students often blame their <a1_0><b4_0>teachers and their textbooks<b4_0/><a1_0/>, despite the availability of libraries and the internet. When someone tries to improve education, <a2_0>the educational establishment itself occasionally showers the person with <b5_0>criticism rather than gratitude<b5_0/><a2_0/>. Better by products of an educational system would be gratitude and determination.
